bill_title: to repeal certain provisions authorizing dual compensation for state employees.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to repeal certain provisions authorizing dual compensation for state employees. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 3-8-4 be amended to read as follows: 3-8-4. Except as provided in § § 3-8-4.1 to 3-8-5.4 3-8-4.3 , inclusive, no person receiving a salary payable out of the state treasury or from the funds of any state institution or department, shall may , during the period for which such salary has been or is to be paid, receive any other salary from the state or any institution or department thereof. Section 2. That § 3-8-5.1 be repealed. 3-8-5.1. If the bureau of personnel considers the best interests of the state of South Dakota served by permitting a state employee to be compensated for both his regular employment by the state and for additional services to the state outside the scope of his regular employment rendered to a state institution, department, office, or agency which is other than his primary employer, the bureau may approve such dual compensation. No dual compensation is allowed until the bureau approves the arrangement in accordance with § § 3-8-4 to 3-8-5.4, inclusive. Section 3. That § 3-8-5.2 be repealed. 3-8-5.2. In exercising the powers delegated under § 3-8-5.1, the bureau of personnel shall approve dual compensation arrangements only if a contract or agreement for the services is written and specifies that the regular state employee is the best available talent at a reasonable cost for the additional or supplemental employment. Section 4. That § 3-8-5.3 be repealed. 3-8-5.3. In determining whether a state employee is the best available talent at a reasonable cost, the bureau of personnel may not permit the state employee to consider use of resources of the state department, institution, office or agency for which he primarily works, as being available at no cost to the state employee for purposes or use in relation to the additional or supplemental state position for which he seeks approval or dual compensation. However, the contract or agreement shall define the state government resources that are available at no cost to the state employee. Section 5. That § 3-8-5.4 be repealed. 3-8-5.4. The bureau of personnel shall promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 which shall establish procedures and specific criteria to be used in implementing the provisions of § § 3-8-4.2 to 3-8-5.3, inclusive.
